shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols 3ra-162v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-126v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 127r-140r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 140v-147v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 148ra-158rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 158ra-162vb)
Additiones 1-6.

owners.owner: According to Additio 4, the Ms. belonged to Dawit and his children Samuʾel, Mälkä Ṣedeq and Wälättä Hanna. The name of the original owner has been erased from Additio 4. Presently the Ms. is in private possession.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of 18th - first half of the 19th century (?).

txstates.txstate: The spine cover is torn off. The back board is broken. Most fols. are stained with wax and dirt. Many fols. are torn along the vertical ruled lines. The whole text on fol. 86r has been written over an erasure. A hole was burnt into fol. 91 with minor text loss, many fols. are damaged in the upper area by fire (some have been crudely trimmed thereafter). Fols. 1 and 186 are mutilated.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament visible on the leather cover (at least 6 tool were used: cross hatching, triple line fillet, double circle, double sine wave with dots, x-form, double line fillet with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches (or traces of stitches) at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – [፩]I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – ፪II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – ፫III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – ፭V(10/fols. 43r-52v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 53r-62v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 63r-72v) – ፰VIII(14/fols. 73r-86v) – [፱]IX(10/fols. 87r-96v) – ፲X(10/fols. 97r-106v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 107r-116v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 117r-126v) – ፲፫XIII(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 127r-135v) – ፲፬XIV(10/fols. 136r-145v) – ፲፭XV(10/fols. 146r-155v) – ፲፮XVI(10/fols. 156r-165v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 18r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 151r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

txcolumns.txcolumn: for Texts I-1 to I-3; 2 columns for Texts I-4 and I.5.

rulings.ruling:
For Texts I-1 to I-3: Pricking and ruling are visible. 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling
For Texts I-4 and I.5: Pricking and ruling are visible. 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by upright or slightly left-sloping, thick and broad letters. It becomes right-sloping on fols. 159vb-161rb.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of some of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስብሕዎ in Ps. 150; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ in Canticle 10; doxology at the end of Texts I-2 (fol. 140r) and I-3 (fol. 147v); elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements ofEthiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1 to I-3 and on fol. 158ra; two groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-4 and I-5.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 116r-v) ስቡ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 136r-136v) Text I-4 ሰ፡ (ቅ፡) for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡/ሠረ፡/ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 148ra-va) እ᎓/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 149ra-150va) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 150vb-151ra) ና፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 153ra-154rb) ለ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 154rb) ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 156ra-vb) ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fol. 157rb-vb) Text I-5 ወል፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፈለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 159ra-162ra)

additional.cont: Fol. 1rab: Excerpt from the mälkəˀ-hymn to Fanuel (ChRep p. 202, no. 166).
additional.add: Fol. 1rab:  ሰላም፡ ለዝከርረምከ፡ ዘጊ[ይደ]ልዋ፡ ተበፅኦ፡...
additional.det: ChRep p. 202, no. 166. The note is written in a mediocre hand (hairlines and strong bifocation of some elements) in black and faded red ink. Partly illegible, possibly written over an older note at the bottom of the fol. The angles Fanuʾel and Mikaʾel are mentioned.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v: Calendaric note containing the feast days.
additional.det: The ink of the note is almost completely faded, and the text is illegible.

additional.cont: Fol. 126r-126v: Calendaric note containing the feast days.
additional.det:
Written in a trained hand, the ink is fading out towards the bottom of the fols. and those parts are illegible.
The directive በስመ፡ በል፡ “Recite the Trinitarian formula” is in Amharic, the rest of the note is written in Gǝʿǝz.

The note consists of two parts, written in red and black ink by two different scribes. The original note was partly erased and complemented with additional text, given here in brackets. According to the note, the book belongs to Dawit and his children Samuʾel, Mälkä Ṣedeq and Wälättä Hana.

additional.cont: Fol. 163ra-164ra: ˀƎsäggəd läki ˀəgzəˀtəyä Maryam... “I worship Thee, my Lady Mary…” (ChRep p. 318, no. 336).
additional.det: ChRep p. 318, no. 336. The note is written in a mediocre hand, in red and black (letters with strong hairlines, especially for the letter ግ).

additional.cont: Fol. 164rb-va: Prayer to St. Mary from Säˁatat.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by chains of red and black dots. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked on fol. 65v (see also “Decorations”). - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting, used compressed script or wrote in between lines to accommodate the end of a Ps.: e.g., fols.7r, 10v, 60r, 103v. - Some lines of Pss. are written over erasures: e.g., fols. 5v, 6r, the entire fol. 86r was erased and rewritten. - Spaces for rubrication are left unfilled on fols. 151v, 152r. - Notes written in the upper margins or in between lines in the same hand: fols. 143v, 144v, 145v. - Writing exercises and crude doodles: fols. 1v, 2r, 164v, 165r. - Erased note: fol. 165ra. - Notes in a secondary hand and faded red ink (partly illegible) are written throughout the Ms., e.g. fols. 25v, 27v, 29r, 32v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 13r, 23r, 33r, 43r, 53r, 63r, 73r, 97r, 107r, 117r, 127r, 136r, 146r, 156r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A red thread inserted in the upper corner of fols. 140, 147.

drawing.details: Fol. 65v: Drawing of a stylized cross to mark the middle of the Psalter, combined with the Amharic word እኵለ “half”, in red and black, connected with a red line to the punctuation sign in the same line

frames.frame: - Fol. 86v: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating Ps. 99 and 100; geometric motifs. - Fol. 147v: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating Texts I-3 and I-4; geometric motifs.
